We cannot wait for the next natural disaster to hit to prepare, we need to increase community resilience ahead of time. This is why next week, I'll be holding a Rules Subcommittee hearing on community resilience & the impacts of natural disasters on the budget process.

Sept. is National Preparedness Month. Check in w/ neighbors on how you can help each other out before & after a storm. As extreme hurricanes, wildfires & superstorms become more routine, the fed gov't must take a more proactive approach to help states prepare. #BeReady #NatlPrep
I offer my deepest condolences to Cokie’s family during this very sad time of loss.

Cokie Roberts was a veteran broadcast journalist paving the way for women in the newsroom. She was a trailblazer in broadcasting, whose life & legacy will always live on for future generations of journalists following in her footsteps.

Pleased to join @janschakowsky in introducing H.R. 4296, the Safe Cosmetics and Personal Care Products Act of 2019, to ensure that toxic ingredients don’t make their way into our personal care products, avoid #animaltesting, & protect highly exposed & vulnerable populations!
House & Senate Republicans can stick their heads in the tar sands all they want, but pumping more fossil fuels will only keep us stuck in the times! #ProtectOurCoasts

This plan is risking billions of dollars & millions of jobs from industries that depend on a clean, healthy ocean. The Atlantic & Pacific ocean economies contributed more than $94B & $43.5B, respectively, to our country’s GDP, proving the need to safeguard our natural resources.

#DidYouKnow? Wealth from the sale of enslaved Africans & their labor created global capitalism & set the economic foundation for Europe, the Caribbean & the Americas. @IPS_DC found that the avg Black family would need 228 yrs to obtain the wealth of a White family. #400YearsLater pic.twitter.com/1ciRCpZn0F

Slavery in the US lasted 246 yrs. Enslaved African Americans worked 10+ hrs/day in dangerous conditions & often worked 18-hr days in peak cotton-picking & sugar harvesting seasons. The psychological & economic toll of slavery still has modern-day consequences. #400YearsLater pic.twitter.com/e88Yt7v0Uc
